why is that a bunch of different reasons but a lot of it comes down to the first hour of the market is very volatile there are a lot of orders resting from the night before that are getting pushed through from Pension funds that need to clear out their trades and so on and so forth they're not really caring about getting optimal fills so they're just blasting stuff through this is where everything is digested quickly so the first half hour to of a market tends to be pretty Applause busy the other thing is because there are now daily expirations you'll notice that the rate of Decay is actually a little bit slower in the beginning of the day relative to the end of the day and it's the same thing that you'll see with options in general where it gets as parabolic as you can into expiration but that's just happening on a shortened zero DTE time frame so when you're entering these things first thing right on the open you're going to see more money you're going to see a higher premium received but a lot of that's not actually going to Decay out for again relative to a zero DTE time frame until later in the day so you're really holding things exposing yourself to a lot of directional risk unless you're Delta hedging and Gamma hedging these positions which SPX is very difficult to do in any sort of peer sense so that's
